instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2390: What is 820-2390? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.CHGR_AMON: What is CHGR_AMON? CHGR_AMON provides DC current sense information to the SMC(System management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip). It comes from the battery charging chip that controls the laptop charger, battery charging, and creation of PPBUS_G3H(ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip depending on the logic board part number and model). This is used for sensors. If a DC current sense sensor is reading off in diagnostics, this is a place to start looking. .
definitions.CHGR_BMON: What is CHGR_BMON? CHGR_BMON goes between the ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 that charges the battery & creates PPBUS_G3H and the SMC(system management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip) and provides current sensing information on battery charging to the SMC. If diagnostics reveal an off reading or failure with the charger current sense, this is a good place to start troubleshooting..
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> stuck on 1.6v
threads.message:
i have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> stuck on 1.6v. 
i replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7220</TRANSISTOR> but no change

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> stuck on 1.6v
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> correct voltage?
What about <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> level?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> stuck on 1.6v
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> stuck on 1.6v
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> stuck on 1.6v
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> stuck on 1.6v
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> still 8.2V?
That's no good..
If yes, check voltage and diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

Do you get Magsafe green light, without battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> stuck on 1.6v
threads.message:
i have a green light on MagSafe without battery and with the battery, it goes orange 
SCL/SDA 0.502

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> still 8.2

I already rebelled SMC 
the logicboard consuming 0.12a without the battery, after plugging the battery it goes up to 0.8a 
I think the battery charging

I put a photo with a thermal camera, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> get hot

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> stuck on 1.6v
threads.message:
Does it start in SMC bypass?
Try other <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> stuck on 1.6v
threads.message: yes it started in ?SMC bypass, i already replaced the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> stuck on 1.6v
threads.message:
Post <SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL>/BMON voltages.
Check exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

Check <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with other DMM.
Post voltage on F7040/41; pin1 of L7030/31 is wrong point test!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> stuck on 1.6v
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL> 0.035V without battey 
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL> 0.035v 
Resistance between pins 17/18  20.3ohm
Resistance between pins 27/28  20.3ohm
what is DMM ?

F7040/41 8.39V
L7030/31  8.39V

sometimes when it starts with the power bottom

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> stuck on 1.6v
threads.message:
So you have correct <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> now.
Maybe before too, but you've measured on wrong point...

Did you change <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> stuck on 1.6v
threads.message: Just replaced <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR>, I found that the keyboard had a problem. When I plug the flex in the motherboard it stop charging the battery. The power consumption of charging drop to 0.02a

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> stuck on 1.6v
threads.message: Check <SIGNAL>3V3_S3</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> when KB is connected.
